newsitem.title: USA: NASD to give G-37 waiver requests critical review.
newsitem.headline: NASD to give G-37 waiver requests critical review.

text.p: A top NASD official said Friday that any waivers that the group grants to Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board's pay-to-play ban must meet four criteria spelled out in the rule.

John Pinto, executive vice president of member regulation, made the statement following a speech earlier Friday by the National Association of Securities Dealer's new muni compliance chief Malcolm Northam.
Northam told broker-dealer compliance employees meeting here that bond firms need clearer guidance from his group on when they qualify for waivers under MSRB's pay-to-play rule.

He said he thinks the association should consider granting waivers in cases involving one-time transgressions, modest dollar amounts, firms with clear procedures in place for monitoring contributions, and other factors.
Pinto said the factors outlined by Northam are among "any number that one could take into account" when deciding if a firm qualifies for an exemption under MSRB's criteria.
The factors outlined by Northam "are not stand-alone criteria" by any means, Pinto said.
